(Oh, and they’re coffee roasters too.)ORDER THE: croissants; sourdough bread with whipped double cream butter and cheese; and soft-serve made using leftover steamed milk topped with a coffee crisp in summer. The super-flaky croissant—Copenhagen bakers somehow seem to build in extra photogenic layers—is available plain, with cinnamon sugar, chocolate, or almond, but it’s the one brushed with espresso that takes the, um, cake.THE VIBE IS: industrial cozy.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m.—Christine MuhlkePhoto by Ditte IsagerPhoto by Ditte IsagerWE ALSO LOVEMirabellePlan a mini croissant- and yogurt-filled vacation at this café-like spot in NørreboroDemocratic CoffeeOne more reason to love the library (or at least this Indre By one): buttery croissantsJuno the BakeryFuel up for those canalside bike rides with these outstanding Østerbro carbsExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
